alert.note: Alert for Pottawatomie (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 08 at 12:02PM CDT until June 09 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Oklahoma, including the following counties, Cleveland, Grady, McClain and Pottawatomie. * WHEN...Until 315 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1202 PM CDT, Heavy rain due to thunderstorms has already occured. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southern Oklahoma City, Norman, Chickasha, Newcastle, Blanchard, Purcell, Noble, Tuttle, Slaughterville, Lexington, Goldsby, Minco, Dibble, Washington, Cole, Amber, Bridge Creek, Pocasset, Etowah and Middleberg. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
